data.title: ♫♯ Musical chairs ♩♯ ♫ ♩.
data.statement:
Write a program to find the player that has no chair at the end of [[music]].

Players move counterclockwise around chairs, one chair per beat.
Players are numbered from {{1}} to [[n]].
The [[n]] - 1 chairs are arranged in a circle and there is one spot in the circle where a chair is missing.

Below shows how the start of the game looks like. {{1}} and {{o}} denote the players who are sitting on chairs, and {{x}} denotes the player [[n]] who is standing where a chair is missing. As the music plays, the players move in the direction shown by the arrows: after the first beat, player [[n]] will move to {{1}}, and now player [[n]] - 1 doesn't have a chair as he is on {{x}}.

```
  ooo ↖️
 o   o ↖️
o     {{1}} ↖️
o     {{x}} ⬆️
 o   o ↗️
  ooo ↗️
```

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: an integer [[n]] for the number of <<players>>.
<<Line 2>>: a space-separated string [[music]] of alphabetic notes ({{A}} to {{G}}) , optionally digits ({{2}} or {{4}}) , half-beat {{.}} and sharp {{#}}.
{{A}} to {{G}} are all 1 beat
{{2}} and {{4}} change note length to 2 beats and 4 beats respectively
{{.}} adds half beat length to a note
{{#}} is a  sharp that has no effect on the length
`Example`
G F4 A B2# C4. G D
data.outputDescription: Print the player number that has no chair when the [[music]] stops.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Write a program to find the player that has no chair at the end of music.

Players move counterclockwise around chairs, one chair per beat.
Players are numbered from 1 to n.
The n - 1 chairs are arranged in a circle and there is one spot in the circle where a chair is missing.

Below shows how the start of the game looks like. 1 and o denote the players who are sitting on chairs, and x denotes the player n who is standing where a chair is missing. As the music plays, the players move in the direction shown by the arrows: after the first beat, player n will move to 1, and now player n - 1 doesn't have a chair as he is on x.


  ooo ↖️
 o   o ↖️
o     1 ↖️
o     x ⬆️
 o   o ↗️
  ooo ↗️





   

      
Input

      
Line 1: an integer n for the number of players.
Line 2: a space-separated string music of alphabetic notes (A to G) , optionally digits (2 or 4) , half-beat . and sharp #.
A to G are all 1 beat
2 and 4 change note length to 2 beats and 4 beats respectively
. adds half beat length to a note
# is a  sharp that has no effect on the length
Example

G F4 A B2# C4. G D

   

   

      
Output

      
Print the player number that has no chair when the music stops.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
3 ≤ n ≤ 1000
1 ≤ length(music) ≤ 100

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
3
A G

         

         

            
Output

            
1
